title: Advanced Wellness Plus Insurance Overview
summary: The slide features a promotional image for Advanced Wellness Plus, highlighting a healthcare interaction between a medical professional and an elderly patient. The branding includes a logo and the name 'Advanced Wellness Plus.' The slide also mentions American Financial Security Life Insurance Co., indicating that the limited benefit health insurance plans are underwritten by this company. It references specific policy forms and their issuance to the National Congress of Employers.

title: Advanced Wellness Plus Benefits Overview
summary: The slide provides a detailed breakdown of the benefits offered under the 'Advanced Wellness Plus' plan, categorized by different coverage levels (100A, 100, 200, 200+, 300, 500, 750, 1000). It includes various benefits such as Hospital Confinement, Primary and Specialty Care Doctors Office Visits, Emergency Room, Basic Pathology & Radiology, Advance Studies, Surgery, Anesthesia, Mental Health (Inpatient and Outpatient), Supplemental Accident (Inpatient Admission and Emergency Room), Hospital Intensive Care Unit, Additional Hospital Admission, Accidental Death, and Critical Illness. Each benefit is detailed with per day or per admission amounts and maximum days covered. Notably, benefits vary significantly across different coverage levels, with higher levels offering more extensive coverage. Additional notes mention exclusions for pre-existing conditions for 12 months and a 30-day waiting period post-coverage effective date.

title: Overview of Advanced Wellness Plus and NCE Membership
summary: The slide provides an overview of the National Congress of Employers (NCE), a national association for small and medium-sized businesses in the U.S., offering networking, advocacy, and information sharing. It highlights the benefits of NCE membership, including valuable services and superior customer service. Upon successful application and payment, members receive a Purchase Confirmation email with the NCE Membership Handbook and insurance certificate. Fulfillment packets are mailed within 7-10 business days. The slide also explains the monthly membership billing process, including a non-refundable enrollment fee and the availability of credit card and bank automatic draft options. It describes Limited Medical Coverage as a plan that supplements major medical plans, providing basic insurance coverage with specific caps. Eligibility is for adult members aged 18-65 and dependent children aged 1-25.

title: Advanced Wellness Plus - GapAfford Plus NCE Membership Benefits
summary: The slide outlines the benefits of the GapAfford Plus program, which offers savings on medical expenses without deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, or age restrictions. It includes a prescription discount benefit with savings on brand-name and generic medications, and access to the Aetna Dental Access Network for dental services. The OUTLOOK Vision Network provides discounts on eyewear and eye care services. Pet Rx offers savings on pet medications. Alternative medicine, chiropractic care, and hearing savings programs are available, along with imaging savings and medical bill negotiations. Members can save on medical supplies, laboratory services, physical therapy, vitamins, and supplements. The program also offers a 24/7 Health Information Line and Nurse Help Line. The benefits are not insurance and are not available in certain states.

title: Hospital Indemnity Insurance Limitations & Exclusions
summary: The slide outlines the limitations and exclusions of a hospital indemnity insurance policy. It specifies that benefits will not be provided for treatments, services, or supplies that are not medically necessary, not prescribed by a doctor, experimental, or provided by an immediate family member. Additional exclusions include dental procedures, elective and cosmetic surgeries, felonies or illegal occupations, manipulations of the musculoskeletal system, self-inflicted injuries, war-related injuries, work-related injuries, and pre-existing conditions. There is a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits, and no coverage for voluntary abortion unless life-threatening. Coverage provisions are briefly described, and claims can be mailed or submitted electronically to the specified addresses.
